section.marginalnote: Appointment of assessment commissioner and members

subsection.subsectiontext: The Lieutenant Governor in Council may appoint

paragraph.paragraphtext: members of the board of directors of the authority.

subsection.subsectiontext: The Lieutenant Governor in Council must appoint a member of the authority as chair of the board of directors.

The assessment commissioner must be paid remuneration, must receive the pension and other benefits and is subject to the terms and conditions of employment determined by the Lieutenant Governor in Council.

change.changenote: Section 12 BEFORE repealed by 2007-13-43, effective September 24, 2007 (BC Reg 292/2007).

subsection.subsectiontext: The assessment commissioner appointed under this Act must do all of the following:

paragraph.paragraphtext: perform the duties and exercise the powers conferred on the assessment commissioner under this or any other Act;
carry out policies consistent with this Act, the Assessment Act and any other Act or law respecting assessment;
develop and administer a complete system of property assessment;
make reports and recommendations to the authority or on request of the authority, respecting any matter that the assessment commissioner considers advisable in carrying out the purposes of this Act;
give directions respecting the preparation and completion of assessment rolls.

subsection.subsectiontext: The assessment commissioner has and may exercise all of the powers of an assessor.

change.changenote: Section 13 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by 2007-13-44, effective September 24, 2007 (BC Reg 292/2007).

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite the Public Service Act but subject to the regulations, the authority may appoint a secretary of the board of directors and other officers and employees as it considers necessary to its function, set their remuneration and designate their functions and duties.

Despite the Public Service Act, the authority or, if authorized by the authority, the assessment commissioner, may appoint assessors, appraisers and other officers and employees necessary to carry out this Act, set their remuneration, designate their functions and duties, and supervise their activities.

subsection.subsectiontext: On or before April 15 in each year, the authority must forward to the tax collector of every municipality in British Columbia and to the Surveyor of Taxes a certified copy of the bylaw of the authority imposing the taxes under this Act.

The proceeds of the taxes levied and collected must be paid to the authority by the municipality or the Minister of Finance and Corporate Relations, as the case may be, before August 1 in the year the tax was levied.

On or before February 1 in each year, the amount received by the Surveyor of Taxes or the tax collector in a municipality by way of grant in lieu of taxes under the Municipal Grants Act (Canada) from the government of Canada or from a corporation included in Schedule III or IV of that Act in the immediately preceding calendar year must be paid to the authority in an amount attributable to the portion of the grant that is received for authority purposes.

Until receipt of the proceeds of the taxes, the authority may borrow an amount not exceeding the proceeds of the taxes, from the consolidated revenue fund or from a bank, trust company or credit union approved by the Minister of Finance and Corporate Relations, and the loan must be repaid from the proceeds of the taxes.
